{{Infobox military person |name=Philip James Corso |birth_date= {{birth date|1915|5|22}} |death_date= {{death date and age|1998|7|16|1915|5|22}} |birth_place= |death_place=[[Jupiter, Florida|Jupiter]], [[Florida]] |placeofburial= |placeofburial_label= Place of burial |image=Philip J. Corso.jpg |caption= |nickname= |allegiance= [[United States|United States of America]] |branch= [[United States Army]] |serviceyears=February 23, 1942 – March 1, 1963 |rank=[[Lieutenant colonel (United States)|Lieutenant Colonel]] |commands=[[Battalion Commander]] of European Air Defense
Intel Staff Officer Plans & Estimate Branch GHQ [[US Far East Command|Far East Command]]
Chief Special Project Branch G-2 Section of the HQ AFFE 8000th AU Command
Chief Foreign Technology Division of the [[United States Department of Defense]]
Staff Officer in the Plans Division OCRD Washington DC, [[Fort Riley]] |battles=[[World War II]]
[[Korean War]] |awards=[[American Campaign Medal]]
[[American Defense Service Medal]]
[[Bronze Star Medal|Bronze Star]]
[[Commendation Ribbon]]
[[EAME Campaign Medal]]
[[Legion of Merit]]
[[World War II Victory Medal]] |family=Philip Corso Junior (son) |laterwork= |enteredservice= }} '''Philip James Corso''' (May 22, 1915 – July 16, 1998) was an American Army officer. He served in the [[United States Army]] from February 23, 1942, to March 1, 1963,{{cite web |last = |first = |authorlink = |coauthors = |title = Philip J. Corso's Department of the Army Form 66, Officer Qualification Record |work = |publisher = |date = |url = http://www.cufon.org/cufon/corso_da66.htm |doi = |accessdate = 2007-02-10}} and earned the rank of [[Lieutenant colonel (United States)|Lieutenant Colonel]]. Corso published ''[[The Day After Roswell]]'', about how he was involved in the research of extraterrestrial technology recovered from the 1947 [[Roswell UFO Incident]]. On July 23, 1997, he was a guest on the popular late night radio show, ''[[Coast to Coast AM]]'' with [[Art Bell]] where he spoke live about his Roswell story. This interview was rebroadcast by ''Coast to Coast AM'' on July 3, 2010. ==Biography== ===Military career=== After joining the Army in 1942, Corso served in [[United States Army Military Intelligence|Army Intelligence]] in Europe, becoming chief of the US [[Counterintelligence Corps (United States Army)|Counter Intelligence Corps]] in Rome. In 1945, Corso arranged for the safe passage of 10,000 Jewish [[World War II]] refugees out of [[Rome]] to the [[British Mandate of Palestine]]. He was the personal emissary to Giovanni Battista Montini at the Vatican, later [[Pope Paul VI]], during the period when the "[[Ratlines (World War II aftermath)|Nazi Rat Lines]]" were most active. During the [[Korean War]] (1950–1953), Corso performed intelligence duties under General [[Douglas MacArthur]] as Chief of the Special Projects branch of the Intelligence Division, Far East Command. One of his primary duties was to keep track of enemy [[prisoner of war]] (POW) camps in [[North Korea]].{{cite web|last= |first= |authorlink= |coauthors= |title=House Subcommittee on Military Personnel, Statement of Colonel {ret.} Phillip Corso |work= |publisher= |date=1996-09-17 |url=http://www.aiipowmia.com/testimony/corso17.html |doi= |accessdate=2009-05-15 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/20080513101937/http://www.aiipowmia.com//testimony/corso17.html |archivedate=May 13, 2008 }} Corso was in charge of investigating the estimated number of U.S. and other [[United Nations]] POWs held at each camp and their treatment. At later hearings of the [[Senate Select Committee on POW/MIA Affairs]], Corso provided first hand testimony, that many hundreds of American POW's were abandoned at these camps.{{cite web |last = |first = |authorlink = |coauthors = |title = Testimony Of Dolores Alfond Before The Pennsylvania Legislature |work = |publisher = |date = 1999-05-03 |url = http://www.nationalalliance.org/korea/k-alfond.htm |doi = |accessdate = 2007-02-09}}{{cite web |last = |first = |authorlink = |coauthors = |title = Senate Select Committee 49 |work = |publisher = AII POW-MIA |date = 1992-11-11 |url = http://aiipowmia.com/ssc/ssc49.html |doi = |accessdate = 2007-02-10 |archiveurl = http://web.archive.org/web/20061103115429/http://www.aiipowmia.com/ssc/ssc49.html |archivedate = 2006-11-03}} At those hearings, Senator John McCain [R-AZ] dismissed these undocumented and uncorroborated allegations made by Corso as being extremely difficult to believe. McCain implied that Corso was guilty of fabricating the truth and essentially terminated the testimony being given by Corso immediately after a severe verbal reprimand on live television. McCain stated that his personal relationship with Eisenhower led him to believe that Eisenhower was just not capable of allowing known American POWs to remain incarcerated after the termination of the Korean War.{{https://youtu.be/QGmBGBbXrQE?t=26m25s}} Corso was on the [[staff officer|staff]] of President [[Dwight D. Eisenhower|Eisenhower]]'s [[United States National Security Council|National Security Council]] for four years (1953–1957). In 1961, he became Chief of [[the Pentagon]]'s Foreign Technology desk in Army Research and Development, working under Lt. Gen. [[Arthur Trudeau]]. ===''The Day After Roswell''=== {{Main|The Day After Roswell}} [[File:Thedayafterroswell.jpg|thumb|left|120px]] In his book ''The Day After Roswell'' (co-author [[William J. Birnes]]) claims he stewarded extraterrestrial artifacts recovered from a crash near [[Roswell, New Mexico]], in 1947. Corso says a covert government group was assembled under the leadership of Adm. [[Roscoe H. Hillenkoetter]], the first [[director of Central Intelligence]] (see [[Majestic 12]]). Among its tasks was to collect all information on off-planet technology. The US administration simultaneously discounted the existence of flying saucers in the eyes of the public, Corso says. According to Corso, the [[reverse engineering]] of these artifacts indirectly led to the development of accelerated [[particle beam]] devices, [[fiber optics]], [[laser]]s, [[integrated circuit]] chips and [[Kevlar]] material. In the book, Corso claims the [[Strategic Defense Initiative]] (SDI), or "Star Wars", was meant to achieve the destructive capacity of electronic guidance systems in incoming enemy [[warhead]]s, as well as the disabling of enemy spacecraft, including those of extraterrestrial origin. ==Gallery== ===Personal=== File:Philip_j_corso_2.jpg|In [[Rome]], 1945 File:Philip_j_corso_1.jpg|In [[Tokyo]], 1953 File:Philip_j_corso_3.jpg|In [[Germany]], 1960 ===Files=== File:Philip_j_corso_4.gif|DA Form 66 (page 1) File:Philip_j_corso_5.gif|DA Form 66 (page 2) File:Philip_j_corso_6.gif|DA Form 66 (page 3) File:Philip_j_corso_7.gif|DA Form 66 (page 4) File:Philip_j_corso_8.gif|DA Form 66 (page 5) His service number on his id card was 01047930 as shown on TV. ==See also== {{Portal|United States Army|World War II}} *[[Roswell UFO Incident]] ==References== {{Reflist}} ===Further reading=== {{Refbegin}} *{{cite news |last =W. Nelan |first =Bruce |authorlink = |coauthors = |title =Lost Prisoners Of War: "Sold Down The River"? |work = |publisher =Time (magazine) |date = September 30, 1996 |url =http://www.time.com/time/magazine/article/0,9171,985224,00.html |doi = |accessdate =2007-05-05}} *{{cite web |last =LeBoutillier |first =John |authorlink = |coauthors = |title =POWs: America's Biggest Cover-Up |work = |publisher =News Max |date =June 13, 2000 |url =http://www.newsmax.com/articles/?a=2000/6/12/202658 |format = |doi = |accessdate =2007-05-05}} *{{cite web |last =Huyghe |first =Patrick |authorlink = |coauthors = |title =Taking the UFO Case to Court |work = |publisher =Space.com |date =March 20, 2000 |url =http://www.space.com/spaceimagined/area51/caus_court_000320.html |doi = |accessdate =2007-05-05}} {{Refend}} * ''The Day After Roswell'' (paperback, 1998) ISBN 978-0-671-01756-9 ==External links== {{Sisterlinks|Philip J. Corso}} *[http://www.legacy.com/ns/obitfinder/ssdi-search.aspx?Page=1&countryid=1&daterange=1990-1999&firstname=Philip&lastname=Corso&stateid=12&keyword=&entriesperpage=15 - Obit - Death] *[http://ufos.about.com/od/projectsign/p/corso.htm Philip J. Corso - About - Biography] *[http://www.coasttocoastam.com/guests/454.html Philip J. Corso - Coast to Coast AM - Biography] *[http://www.coasttocoastam.com/shows/2005/01/30.html Philip J. Corso - Coast to Coast AM - William J. Birnes (interview)] *[http://ufoupdateslist.com/2000/aug/m26-033.shtml (Updated) Philip J. Corso Voice Stress Analysis reveals no deception] *{{cite news |last = Holmes|first = Steven A.|authorlink = |coauthors = |title = Hearings Opened On Korea M.I.A.'S |work = |publisher = New York Times |date = 1992-11-11 |url = http://select.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F10617FD345B0C728DDDA80994DA494D81&n=Top%2fNews%2fWorld%2fCountries%20and%20Territories%2fChina |format = |doi = |accessdate = 2007-02-10}} *[http://www.exopolitics.org/Study-Paper-10-Nexus.pdf Space Weapons as Defense - Nexus Magazine vol 13:2 - Michael E. Salla Ph.D] *[http://www.tacklingthetoughtopics.net/Eberhart/eberhart_korean_war.html The Korean War - Tackling the Tough Topics Issue #63 - Darryl Eberhart] *[http://www.logoschristian.org/ftwaltonbeach/ Phillip Corso Jr. talking about aliens and ufos] ===Videos=== *[[Disclosure Project]] - Extraterrestrial Contact and Close Encounter: [http://video.google.com/videoplay?docid=-1761201284029857279&hl=en Part 2] - 2001 *[[Dateline NBC|Dateline (NBC)]] - {{YouTube|enFdECEVGo4|Claims of Close Encounters and Cover Ups}} - 1997 *[[Coast to Coast AM]] - {{YouTube|dDpmCRjx_k8|Radio Interview with Art Bell}} - July 23, 1997 {{UFOs}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Corso, Philip J.}} [[Category:American military personnel of World War II]] [[Category:American military personnel of the Korean War]] [[Category:American UFO writers]] [[Category:United States Army officers]] [[Category:Ufologists]] [[Category:Recipients of the Bronze Star Medal]] [[Category:Recipients of the Legion of Merit]] [[Category:Warren Commission]] [[Category:Roswell UFO incident]] [[Category:1915 births]] [[Category:1998 deaths]] [[Category:20th-century American writers]]
